intro: Hieracium pilosella subsp. inalpestriforme, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in composite inflorescences, typical of the dandelion family. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often growing in open, sunny habitats. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and protected species in many areas.
